intro: Psychotria moratii, commonly known as Morat’s psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Psychotria moratii is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
